div.h2: Our Mission: To develop the genius in every child and create life-long learners.Â

div.p: Students have the opportunity to learn to play a variety of musical instruments beginning in Grade 1. Violin students study the Suzuki method for violin.
of students are involved in the arts or extracurricular activities

p.meta: On February 1st, 2020, the Sage Park Technology Student Association hosted and competed in their first-ever VEX-IQ Squared Away competition this year. The students brought four robots for competition 32868A-D. They competed against 12 other schools in Connecticut, with a total of 42 different robots.Â During the final matches, Sage Park was able to come in third place with 32868A with 61 match points, seventh place with 32868D with 43 match points, and in ninth place was 32868C with 40 match points. Student Drivers are:

ul.li: 32868D- Kanye Pitts, Kyan Jacobsen, and Chaz Fort

div.p: The number of Career and Technical Education Courses offered at Windsor High School. WHS has 14 courses articulated with colleges that students can receive college credit for the course they take in high school. Offerings include participation with Capital Community College,Â Manchester Community College,Â UCONN and Goodwin College. See the Counseling section on the WHS site.
269 graduated in the Class of 2019 which included 13 with High Distinction, 28 with Distinction and 52 National Honor Society members. Congratulations to all!
